titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Common Council Wallabout Park planning records 1978.138
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:11:02 +0000.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn Common Council Wallabout Park planning records
did.abstract: This collection includes records of the Brooklyn mayor, Common Council, and Supreme Court, and petitions pertaining to the planning and opening of a public park at the Wallabout Bay, 1835-1842. An unidentified file of minutes, affidavits, briefs and correspondence is also included.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Common Council Wallabout Park planning records, 1978.138, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Center for Brooklyn History holds the following related materials:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes records of the Brooklyn mayor, Common Council, and Supreme Court, and petitions pertaining to the planning and opening of a public park at the Wallabout Bay, 1835-1842. An unidentified file of minutes, affidavits, briefs and correspondence is also included.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.
